verbs.description: upflower (third-person singular simple present upflowers, present participle upflowering, simple past and past participle upflowered)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, poetic, archaic) To flower; to reach a state of full development or achievement.
examples: The beauteous babe — a sour old beldame's care, / Upflowered at length a matchless maid, and fair.
